import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from ailist import AIList
from ..utilities.h5_utilities import read_summary, write_summary
from ..core import cfDNA



[docs]class cfDNA_summary(object):
    """
    Contains cfDNA summary results
    """

    def __init__(self, data=None, bin_size=100000, genome="hg19", bin_bias_h5_fn=None, outlier_smooth=True,
                 gauss_smooth=False, n_threads=1, tss_fn="hg19_TSS.bed", normal=[0.1, 0.5, 0.9], ploidy=[2],
                 estimatePloidy=False, minSegmentBins=25, maxCN=7, bcp_cutoff=0.3, directory="./",
                 verbose=False):
        """
        Initialize cfDNA object

        Params
        ------
            data : str or :class:`~cfdna.cfDNA`
                Location of the data (bam file name or :class:`~cfdna.cfDNA` object)
            bin_size
                int
            genome
                str
            bin_bias_h5_fn
                str
            outlier_smooth
                bool
            gauss_smooth
                bool
            n_threads
                int
            tss_fn
                str
            normal
                list[float]
            ploidy
                list[float]
            estimatePloidy
                bool
            minSegmentBins
                int
            maxCN
                int
            bcp_cutoff
                float
            directory
                str
            verbose
                bool

        Returns
        -------
            None

        """

        # Initialize metrics
        self.verbose = verbose

        # Add description variables
        if data is None:
            self.metrics = {}
            self.metrics["sam"] = None
            self.metrics["n_frags"] = None
            self.metrics["bin_size"] = None
            self.metrics["genome"] = None
            self.metrics["length_dist"] = None
            self.metrics["frag_profile"] = None
            self.metrics["cnv_bins"] = None
            self.metrics["segments_df"] = None
            self.metrics["wps_bins"] = None
            self.metrics["wps_peaks"] = None
            self.metrics["peak_dist"] = None
            self.metrics["tss_nfr"] = None
            self.metrics["tss_profile"] = None
            self.metrics["nfr"] = None
            self.metrics["median_var"] = None

        elif isinstance(data, str):
            self.metrics = read_summary(data)

        elif isinstance(data, cfDNA.cfDNA):
            # Add descriptions
            self.metrics = {}
            self.metrics["sam"] = data.frags.sam_file
            self.metrics["n_frags"] = data.frags.size
            self.metrics["bin_size"] = bin_size
            self.metrics["genome"] = genome

            # Calculate length distribution
            length_dist_bins = np.max([len(data.length_dist[chrom]) for chrom in data.chroms])
            self.metrics["length_dist"] = np.zeros(length_dist_bins)
            for chrom in data.length_dist:
                n_bins = len(data.length_dist[chrom])
                self.metrics["length_dist"][:n_bins] += data.length_dist[chrom]

            # Calculate fragment profile
            self.metrics["frag_profile"] = data.fragment_profile(bin_size=bin_size, genome=genome)
            self.metrics["frag_profile"].columns = ["seqnames", "start", "end", "counts"]

            # Calculate CNVs
            cnv = data.call_cnvs(bin_size=bin_size, genome=genome, bin_bias_h5_fn=bin_bias_h5_fn,
                                 outlier_smooth=outlier_smooth, gauss_smooth=gauss_smooth,
                                 normal=normal, ploidy=ploidy, estimatePloidy=estimatePloidy,
                                 minSegmentBins=minSegmentBins, maxCN=maxCN, bcp_cutoff=bcp_cutoff)
            self.metrics["hmm_loglik"] = cnv._segments.hmm_loglik
            self.metrics["segments_df"] = cnv.segments_df
            self.metrics["cnv_bins"] = cnv.bins
            self.metrics["chrom_shift"] = cnv.chrom_shift
            self.metrics["genome_len"] = cnv.genome
            self.metrics["median_var"] = cnv.median_var

            # Initialize keys
            self.metrics["wps_bins"] = self.metrics["frag_profile"].copy(deep=True)
            self.metrics["wps_bins"].columns = ["seqnames", "start", "end", "wps"]
            self.metrics["wps_peaks"] = {}
            self.metrics["peak_dist"] = self.metrics["frag_profile"].copy(deep=True)
            self.metrics["peak_dist"].columns = ["seqnames", "start", "end", "peak_dist"]
            self.metrics["tss_nfr"] = pd.DataFrame([], columns=["chrom", "start", "end", "nfr", "pos_score"])
            self.metrics["tss_profile"] = np.zeros(2000)

            # Iterate over chroms
            chroms = np.unique(self.metrics["frag_profile"].loc[:,"seqnames"].values)
            for chrom in chroms:
                if self.verbose: print(chrom)
                # Record starts
                selected_chrom = self.metrics["frag_profile"].loc[:,"seqnames"].values == chrom
                starts = self.metrics["frag_profile"].loc[:,"start"].values[selected_chrom]
                
                if self.verbose: print("   WPS...")
                chrom_wps = data.wps(chrom=chrom, n_threads=n_threads)
                
                if self.verbose: print("   WPS TSS profile")
                self.metrics["tss_profile"] += data.window_mean_scores(chrom_wps, stranded=True)
                
                # Check that WPS was detected
                if chrom_wps is not None:
                    if self.verbose: print("   WPS peaks...")
                    self.metrics["wps_peaks"][chrom] = data.predict_nucleosomes(chrom_wps, window=1000, merge_distance=5,
                                                                        peak_min_length=50, peak_max_length=450)[chrom]
                    
                    if self.verbose: print("   WPS peak distances...")
                    self.metrics["peak_dist"].loc[selected_chrom,"peak_dist"] = data.peak_distances(self.metrics["wps_peaks"], bin_size=1, max_distance=10000)[chrom].loc[starts].values
                    
                    if self.verbose: print("   WPS bins...")
                    self.metrics["wps_bins"].loc[selected_chrom,"wps"] = data.frags.bin_array(chrom_wps[chrom], bin_size=bin_size, method="mean").loc[starts].values
                    
                    # Calculate TSS NFR
                    if self.verbose: print("   TSS NFR")
                    self.metrics["tss_nfr"] = self.metrics["tss_nfr"].append(data.window_nfr(chrom_wps, upstream=1000, downstream=1000, stranded=True, smooth=True, order=35))

                else:
                    self.metrics["wps_peaks"][chrom] = None

            # Calculate NFR
            self.metrics["nfr"] = data.frags.nfr(self.metrics["tss_profile"])

            # Reformat column names
            self.metrics["tss_nfr"].columns = ["seqnames", "start", "end", "nfr", "pos_score"]

    
    def __getitem__(self, key):
        """
        Function like dictionary
        """

        return self.metrics[key]

    
    @property
    def segments_df(self):
        """
        :class:`pandas.DataFrame` of CNV segments
        """

        return self.metrics["segments_df"]

    
    @property
    def hmm_loglik(self):
        """
        :class:`pandas.DataFrame` of hmm results for hmmCNV
        """

        return self.metrics["hmm_loglik"]

    
    @property
    def chrom_shift(self):
        """
        dictionary of chromosome shifts (for plotting)
        """

        return self.metrics["chrom_shift"]

    
    @property
    def genome(self):
        """
        dictionary of chromosome lengths (for plotting)
        """

        return self.metrics["genome_len"]

    
    @property
    def bins(self):
        """
        :class:`pandas.DataFrame` of chromosome bins
        """

        return self.metrics["cnv_bins"]

    
    @property
    def median_var(self):
        """
        int of median segment variance
        """

        return self.metrics["median_var"]



[docs]    def write_seg_file(self, out_fn, sample=None):
        """
        Write segmentation file

        Parameters
        ----------
        out_fn : str
            Output file name
        sample : str 
            Sample name [default:None]

        Returns
        -------
        None
        """
        
        # Open output file
        out = open(out_fn, "w")
        fmt = "{sample}\t{chrom}\t{start}\t{end}\t{n_bins}\t{log2_ratio_median}\n"
        out.write(fmt.replace('}','').replace('{',''))
        
        # Determine sample name
        if sample is None:
            sample = "sample_" + str(int(np.random.random() * 100000000))

        # Determine whether chroms are
        indexes = np.sort(np.unique(self.bins.loc[:,"seqnames"].values, return_index=True)[1])
        chroms = self.bins.loc[:,"seqnames"].values[indexes]
        chrom_index = {}
        for chrom in chroms:
            chrom_index[chrom] = self.bins.loc[:,"seqnames"].values == chrom
        
        # Iterate over segments
        for i in range(self.segments_df.shape[0]):
            seg = self.segments_df.iloc[i,:]
            chrom = seg.loc["chrom"]
            bin_starts = self.bins.iloc[chrom_index[chrom], 1].values
            start = int(seg.loc["start"])
            end = int(seg.loc["end"])
            n_bins = np.sum(np.logical_and(bin_starts >= start, bin_starts < end))
            log2_ratio_median = seg.loc["median"]
            out.write(fmt.format(**locals()))
                
        # Close seg file
        out.close()
